<h1 align="center">
  Tetris
</h1>

a simple tetris game developed in Javascript.

## üöÄ Quick start

    ```shell
    git clone https://github.com/jiwon-seattle/tetris-Javascript
    cd respository
    ```

    Open `index.html` with local browser.

## üßê What I covered Javascript method

<details>
  <summary>addEventListener()</summary>
  The EventTarget method addEventListener() sets up a function that will be called whenever the specified event is delivered to the target. Common targets are Element, Document, and Window, but the target may be any object that supports events (such as XMLHttpRequest).
</details>

<details>
  <summary>querySelector()</summary>
  querySelector method only returns the first item it finds.
</details>

<details>
  <summary>querySelectorAll()</summary>
  querySelectorAll method only returns a list of elements.
</details>

<details>
  <summary>keyCode()</summary>
  keyCode method returns the Unicode character code of the key that triggered the onkeypress event.
</details>

<details>
  <summary>Math.floor()</summary>
  Math.floor returns the largest integer less than or equal to a given number.
</details>

<details>
  <summary>Math.random()</summary>
  Math.random returns a random number between 0 (inclusive), and 1 (exclusive).<br/>
  ex> Math.floor(Math.random() * 10 ); // returns a random # from 0 to 9
</details>

<details>
  <summary>setInterval()</summary>
  setInterval() repeatedly calls a function with a fixed delay between each call.
</details>

<details>
  <summary>Array.some</summary>
  some() method tests whether at least one element in the array passes the test implementation by the provided function.
</details>

Etc. <br/>
* forEach()
* some()
* add()
* remove()
* contains()

<!-- AUTO-GENERATED-CONTENT:END -->
